directive: Improving the docs and landing page with important feature we added related to sandboxing

issues.title: Create sandboxing messaging baseline and claims matrix
issues.body:
## Summary
Define a single source of truth for sandboxing language used across docs and the marketing site so all security claims are accurate and consistent with current CLI behavior.

## Scope
- Audit existing sandbox-related copy in `README.md`, `docs/concepts/security-sandboxing.md`, `docs/cli/run.md`, `docs/cli/config.md`, `apps/www/src/components/landing/*`, and `apps/www/src/app/security/page.tsx`.
- Produce a concise claims matrix covering: default mode, fallback behavior, required Docker version, persistent sandbox flow, and unsandboxed warning language.
- Propose canonical wording for "auto", "required", and "disabled" sandbox modes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- A committed markdown artifact documents current copy, proposed copy, and rationale for each change.
- All claims in the matrix are traceable to current code paths in `packages/cli/src/core/sandbox.ts` and `packages/cli/src/commands/sandbox.ts`.
- The artifact explicitly identifies any stale or conflicting copy that must be updated in follow-up issues.

issues.title: Add full CLI reference page for locus sandbox command
issues.body:
## Summary
Document the new `locus sandbox` command family as a first-class CLI reference page and surface it in docs navigation.

## Scope
- Add `docs/cli/sandbox.md` with subcommands: create, claude login, codex login, status, and remove.
- Include lifecycle expectations, persistent sandbox behavior, and failure modes.
- Link this page from `docs/SUMMARY.md` and `docs/cli/overview.md`.

## Acceptance Criteria
- `docs/cli/sandbox.md` exists and includes at least one runnable example per subcommand.
- The page documents how `config.sandbox.name` and `config.sandbox.enabled` are affected by `locus sandbox` and `locus sandbox rm`.
- Docs navigation includes the new page with no broken links.

issues.title: Expand security-sandboxing concept doc with newly added workflow details
issues.body:
## Summary
Upgrade the conceptual sandboxing doc to reflect the newly added persistent sandbox workflow and operational safeguards.

## Scope
- Extend `docs/concepts/security-sandboxing.md` with a section for user-managed persistent sandboxes (create, login, reuse, remove).
- Document provider-specific behavior for Codex inside Docker sandbox environments.
- Add a dedicated section for `.sandboxignore` behavior, intent, and limitations.
- Clarify lifecycle differences between ephemeral per-run sandboxes and user-managed persistent sandboxes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Concept doc includes explicit command sequence for persistent workflow: `locus sandbox` -> `locus sandbox claude|codex` -> normal `locus run/exec` -> `locus sandbox rm`.
- The doc distinguishes what is automatic vs user-managed with unambiguous wording.
- The troubleshooting section includes at least one case for persistent sandbox drift (name in config but VM missing).

issues.title: Update onboarding docs for sandbox-first setup and verification
issues.body:
## Summary
Revise getting-started documentation so new users can verify sandbox readiness and choose the correct safety mode before first execution.

## Scope
- Update `docs/getting-started/installation.md` with Docker sandbox prerequisites and verification commands.
- Update `docs/getting-started/quickstart.md` to include a sandbox validation checkpoint before first `locus run`.
- Add explicit guidance for when Docker sandbox support is unavailable and when to use `--sandbox=require`.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Installation doc contains a dedicated "Sandbox setup" section with required Docker version and verification command output expectations.
- Quickstart contains at least one sandbox-required example and one safe fallback explanation.
- Cross-links point to `docs/concepts/security-sandboxing.md` and `docs/cli/sandbox.md` without dead references.

issues.title: Integrate sandboxing as a core value proposition on landing page
issues.body:
## Summary
Update the homepage narrative to highlight sandboxing as a core product strength and route users to the correct deep-dive docs.

## Scope
- Update hero/supporting links in `apps/www/src/components/landing/Hero.tsx` to include sandboxing.
- Add or replace one feature card in `apps/www/src/components/landing/FeatureGrid.tsx` for Docker sandbox isolation with concrete proof text.
- Ensure CTA and deep-link destinations include sandbox docs where relevant.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Landing page includes at least one prominent sandboxing message above the fold and one detailed feature mention in the core strengths section.
- All new copy aligns with the canonical wording established in issue #1.
- Every sandboxing claim links to an existing docs page that validates the claim.

issues.title: Refresh /security page to accurately represent sandbox isolation model
issues.body:
## Summary
Align the website security page with current sandbox architecture and execution modes so security posture is technically accurate.

## Scope
- Update `apps/www/src/app/security/page.tsx` copy to include Docker Desktop microVM isolation and sandbox mode behavior.
- Differentiate host-local execution from sandboxed execution to avoid ambiguous or contradictory statements.
- Add links to `/docs/concepts/security-sandboxing` and sandbox CLI docs for operational details.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Security page includes a dedicated sandbox section with accurate statements about filesystem, credential, and network boundaries.
- Content explains the default behavior and unsandboxed fallback without overstating guarantees.
- Copy is reviewed against issue #1 claims matrix and has no unresolved contradictions.

issues.title: Add docs-site QA checks for sandbox links and claim consistency
issues.body:
## Summary
Introduce lightweight validation to prevent future drift between sandbox implementation, docs, and marketing copy.

## Scope
- Add a checklist or automated step in docs/site CI for sandboxing-related broken links.
- Add a maintainers checklist item requiring updates to sandbox docs and landing/security copy when sandbox command behavior changes.
- Verify references to missing files (for example stale positioning-brief pointers) are resolved or replaced.

## Acceptance Criteria
- A repeatable command or CI job validates links for all touched sandboxing docs/pages.
- Contribution guidance includes a sandbox documentation update requirement for CLI behavior changes.
- No broken internal links remain in sandbox-related docs and landing/security pages.
